g.text: START
input
Variable["whirling.elevator_main_reached"]
Elevator: The elevator stands open, inviting you to step inside.
Variable["auto.visited_pinball_workshop"] and Variable["whirling.elevator_use"] == false and Variable["whirling.elevator_logic_use"] == false
Elevator: The elevator lurches and squeaks, like the belly of some ancient beast, as you descend....
You: Look in.
Elevator: There are large rectangular buttons: 'Monter', 'Descendre', and an international: 'Call for Emergency Assistance'. That third one appears to be broken.
Kim Kitsuragi: "Look on the bright side: if it fails, we will only sustain minor injuries. I'm talking three, maybe four months in the hospital. Maximum five."
Variable["whirling.elevator_main_reached"]
!(Variable["whirling.elevator_main_reached"])
You: "That means it's not really that safe, is it."
Kim Kitsuragi: "Seems like a small freight elevator for transporting machinery. For that -- it's pretty quaint." He taps the on the guttering light bulb -- it's golden in the dark.
Elevator: Looks like one would fit in there, yes. Although it's also surprisingly human -- in the golden light of that ancient bulb.
Just about. If tilted precisely. For a small elevator this one is surprisingly nice. The ancient golden bulb gutters in the dark.
You: "This elevator must have been needed to transport the pinball machines up and down."
"So it was mostly pinball machines riding this elevator."
You: Could this have been for moving pinball machines up and down?
Would a pinball machine really fit in here?
You: Go down.
You: (Close the doors and go up.)
Elevator: The elevator screeches and rattles, like the belly of some ancient beast, as it carries you upward...
You: [Leave.]
You: "So it's *not* a message from the future?"
Logic: This elevator must have been used to transport pinball machines to and from the upstairs workshop.
Kim Kitsuragi: "If some form of time travel becomes possible in the future, I doubt its inventors will use it to repair elevators in Martinaise,” the lieutenant responds with a grave voice.
Perception (Sight): The maintenance card under the control panel reads: 'Last Maintenance: 10 July '88'.
Kim Kitsuragi: "No, I think the bureaucrats just forgot about this back-room elevator after the Revolution."
You: Look at the elevator controls.
elevatormainhub
You: "This elevator was last maintained in the *future*?"
You: "That's disappointing."
Jump to: [elevatormainhub]

Kim Kitsuragi: "At the end of the last century." He nods. "Look on the bright side. If it fails, we will only sustain minor injuries -- I'm talking three, maybe four months in the hospital. maximum five."
Rhetoric: It appears his whole enthusiasm is sarcastic.
Kim Kitsuragi: "No, it was maintained in '88 of the *previous* century."
Variable["auto.visited_pinball_workshop"] and Variable["whirling.elevator_use"] == false and Variable["whirling.elevator_logic_use"] == false
Elevator: This small elevator is dimly lit by a bulb that's been glowing for ages. The latticed cage is open, inviting you to step inside.
Encyclopedia: A small steel plaque reads 'Halter 800'. Halter is a Königsteiner lift company who went out of business a long, long time ago.
Elevator: The deep scratches on the floor suggest it was used as a freight elevator -- for transporting heavy machinery. And one man.
Kim Kitsuragi: "Seems so, although it's pretty... quaint for a freight elevator." He taps on the guttering light bulb -- it's golden in the dark.
Elevator: Smells of nougat and sweat. Your head brushes up against the ceiling. There is a control panel to your right -- and just enough room for two people to fit in.
You: "I wonder what this elevator was used for."
Jump to: [elevatormainhub]
You: What were you used for, elevator?
You: "It says the last maintenance was in '88."
!(Variable["auto.visited_pinball_workshop"] and Variable["whirling.elevator_use"] == false and Variable["whirling.elevator_logic_use"] == false)
Jump to: [elevatormainhub]
Kim Kitsuragi: "That it does." The lieutenant peeks in. "I say -- let's brave it."
You: [Leave.]
You: "Eighty-eight... This elevator was maintained a long time ago."
